alert.note: Alert for Custer County Plains; Pine Ridge Area (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 19 at 1:36PM MDT until September 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 321, AND 322... .DISCUSSION...Critical fire wx conditions have developed this afternoon over northeast WY and far western SD where RH is around 10 percent and westerly winds are gusting to around 30 mph. Conditions will improve this evening, but some areas will see poor RH recovery overnight ahead of an approaching cold front. A cold front slides through the area late tonight/early Tuesday with a period of gusty northwest winds behind the front and much cooler temperatures for mid week. The next chance of wetting rain will be Wednesday night into Thursday night. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 325 AND 326... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 325 Custer County Plains and 326 Pine Ridge Area. * WINDS...West 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Custer County Plains; Pine Ridge Area
